Articles.Content:
Celestial objects revealed so far:

1: Red planet

2: Moon of red planet

3: Purple planet

4: Green planet

That would make a total of 7 celestial objects (8 if sun included) when succesfull implemented in 0.17
What about the 4th rocky planet? I guess they could push it back but it's not that hard just to make a new one.

Ding ding ding I believe we have a winner.

N-n-n-n-n-nope! But getting ever-so-slightly warmer.

This is what I see:

Also nope.

Edited August 6, 2012 by NovaSilisko

N-n-n-n-n-nope!

Notice how Nova didn't deny mine!

EDIT:

Any more theories?

Edited August 6, 2012 by Candre
Nova let me guess, is it a parachute? Look at it sideways. TELL ME!!!
I'm still betting on the space walrus.
Well in 2001 the monolith is orbiting Jupiter and since we are only getting one gas planet this update, I think it is that
Someone already guessed that :/ So sadly no...

What about the 4th rocky planet? I guess they could push it back but it's not that hard just to make a new one.

Hmmm, that brings me to the following question: how does a developer make a celestial object? I assume there is a gravitational point in space with set parameters, then a collision-model around it and a texture that exactly matches the collision-model. I've made maps for Tomb Raider and Half-life 2 a while (no prof) and thus can image the huge amounts of work involved in the creation of a planet/moon ... !
I'm going to guess it's a Kraken of some sort, probably a monument to its demise.

Here is the retouched picture from awhile back, now, try to tell me that over on the left there isn't something tht looks like an eye and a set of jaws. The texture of the top area suggests a underwater picture being taken, and there is something that oddly resembles a space shuttle looking thing to the left. Also, Nova said only one idea has been close to guessing what it is.

Ding ding ding I believe we have a winner.

Hmm. That picture has me 95% convinced that the object in the foreground is a rocket, and by now I think it's clear the one in the background is a planet/moon.

The object behind the rocket, however, has me completely and utterly stumped.

If you look at a1fonso's retouched image you can see at the bottom of the image a very large, dark sphere - a moon or planet that it's orbiting - which is eclipsed by the greenish disc. That leads me to believe that that disc cannot be a planet, but a part itself. My rendition is above, without the supposed Kerbal. Ignore the command pod.

EDIT: The light angle is different in the original image, but this should still fit

EDIT:

Kerbal hanging onto debris?

Edited August 6, 2012 by Candre
Unless he's being deliberately evil, it'll be a picture of something new.

The bottom of the retouched image also looks darker than the rest, indicating a surface instead of the bottom of a sphere?

On the other hand, Candre's craft really seems to fit

Off-topic: anyone else having trouble viewing the pictures on Nova's profile? Permissions aren't letting me

Hmmm, that brings me to the following question: how does a developer make a celestial object?

I'm guessing everything in centered at the center of the planet,add the ground (after this point it only applies for planets for water) with places for water,and then they set a sea level.

Also they had to set how thick the atmosphere is and how hard the ship needs to be pulled towards the center for gravity.

Bingo! Of course I could be completely wrong, ask Nova if you really wanna know.

Edited August 6, 2012 by swiftgates24
I forgot to add, I ROCK!!!

I modified that "final transmision" included here for reference, and made it look more like what I saw in my mind's eye

Original:

It's a lightspeed boat!
Is this monolith talk a reference to 2001: A Space Odyssey?

It also refers to the monoliths added to the game as Easter Eggs. Search for 'easter egg' in the forums and you will find a few threads discussing it, including links to a mod that can help you find them!
He said something to someone about being close when they mentioned underwater and jaws and the like.
That was me.
A water planet?
a water monster that kills you if you swim too deep? Swimming underwater added into the game? SUBMARINES?
Im guessing the new update will be in October, on the aniversery of sputnik 1
last time Harvester was quiet for days on end we got an update

Guys, there is no point in discussing the time to the next update, we have only recently had 0.16, and if members keep asking or speculating about updates they will draw the ire of the moderation team.
